attributes.action: allow more time (at least six months) for a FULL public and parliamentary debate on whether or not to retain our nuclear weapons capability, before holding a public referendum and open parliamentary vote on this fundamental issue of national security
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
It is evident that your government is trying to push through the Trident replacement programme without anything like a democratic process. This issue is far too important for the British public and Parliament to allow this to happen. 

You owe it to us and to our children and grandchildren to let us have a say in our future nuclear policy. In any true democracy, it is not the place of Government to dictate terms to its citizens on such a fundamental issue as the future security of the nation, especially when the proposed programme is expected to cost the UK taxpayer in the region of 30 billion pounds.
